title: Augmented Reality-Based Academic Library Utilization Training: Enhancing Workplace Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic library usage experience and smartphone application skills
context.additional_context: Program for office workers to improve academic resource search and utilization skills, leveraging augmented reality technology accessible solely via smartphones (no PC required)

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify the locations of key academic library services (literature search, material checkout, reference management) in 3D space using an augmented reality app
Learners can receive recommendations for three or more relevant additional materials in an augmented reality environment based on scanned academic resources via smartphone camera
Learners can reproduce procedures to locate two types of materials needed for assignments through a 10-minute virtual library tour

resources: Free Augmented Reality Creation Platform (Unity MARS, AR Foundation)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
